body: Land vehicles carry occupants and cargo over hard earth or similar terrain. They are typically propelled by muscle, but can be moved by a variety of propulsion methods. The following are the most common types of land vehicles, including all land vehicles that characters can purchase in the Core Rulebook.
name: Land Vehicles

sections.forward_facing: toward the creatures pulling the vehicle
sections.acceleration: the speed of the pulling creature(s)
sections.propulsion: muscle (pulled; 6 Medium creatures or 2 Large creatures)
sections.driving_space: the most forward squares if the carriage's upper deck.
sections.maximum_speed: twice the speed of the pulling creature(s)
sections.decks: 2; a lower cab with enough room for four passengers, and an upper deck with room for a driver and another passenger.
sections.name: Carriage
sections.driving_check: Handle Animal or Profession (driver) (in the case of creatures with animal intelligence pulling the vehicle), Diplomacy or Intimidate (in the case of intelligent creatures pulling the vehicle)

sections.forward_facing: toward the creatures pulling the vehicle
sections.acceleration: the speed of the pulling creature(s) -5 ft.
sections.propulsion: muscle (pulled; 2 Medium creatures or 1 Large creature)
sections.driving_space: the most forward square of the cart
sections.maximum_speed: twice the speed of the pulling creature(s) -10 ft.
sections.name: Cart
sections.driving_check: Handle Animal or Profession (driver) (in the case of creatures with animal intelligence pulling the vehicle), Diplomacy or Intimidate (in the case of intelligent creatures pulling the vehicle)

sections.forward_facing: toward the creatures pulling the vehicle
sections.acceleration: half the speed of the pulling creature(s)

sections.driving_space: the two most forward squares of the chariot
sections.maximum_speed: twice the speed of the pulling creature(s)
sections.name: Chariot, Medium
sections.driving_check: Handle Animal or Profession (driver) (in the case of creatures with animal intelligence pulling the vehicle), Diplomacy or Intimidate (in the case of intelligent creatures pulling the vehicle)

sections.forward_facing: toward the creatures pulling the vehicle or the front of the sleigh in the case of air current propulsion
sections.acceleration: half the speed of the pulling creature(s) (muscle), or 30 ft. (current)
sections.propulsion: muscle (pulled; 4 Medium creatures or 1 Large creature; on ice, the creatures must be clawed rather than hoofed) or current (air; 8-square sail; hp 40)
sections.driving_space: the two most forward squares of the sleigh
sections.driving_device: reins (muscle propulsion) or rigging (air current propulsion)
sections.maximum_speed: twice the speed of the pulling creature(s) (muscle), or 100 ft. (current)
sections.squares: 4 (10 ft. by 10 ft.; 3 feet high or 13 feet high with sail)
sections.name: Sleigh
sections.driving_check: Handle Animal or Profession (driver) (in the case of creatures with animal intelligence), Diplomacy or Intimidate (in the case of intelligent creatures pulling the vehicle), or Acrobatics (in the case of air current; +10 to the DC)

sections.forward_facing: one side of the square vehicle space
sections.propulsion: alchemical (10 squares of alchemical engines; hardness 8, hp 200)
sections.weapons: 2 Large direct-fire ranged siege engines on the arms
sections.driving_space: a single 5-ft.-by-5-ft. square that contains the two levers that serve as the steam giant's driving device; these levers are located on the third (top) deck of the vehicle
sections.driving_device: two levers used to move the legs
sections.decks: 3; The two lower decks give access to the alchemical engine that powers the steam giant. These lower decks have no windows or other way to see outside of the vehicle.  The upper deck is an observation deck that contains the alchemical giant's driving device and driving square.
sections.name: Steam Giant
sections.driving_check: Knowledge (arcana) or Craft (alchemy) +10 to the DC
